article:
Events and trends *728 BCâPiye invades Egypt, conquering Memphis, and
receives the submission of the rulers of the Nile Delta. He founds the Twenty-
fifth dynasty of Egypt. *727 BCâBabylonia makes itself independent of
Assyria, upon the death of Tiglath-Pileser III. *725 BCâShalmaneser V starts
a 3 year siege of Israel
*  725 BCâSparta conquers the neighboring region of Messenia and takes over the
   land. *724 BCâThe Assyrians start a four-year siege of Tyre.
*  724 BCâThe [[Ancient Greek units of measurement|diaulos]] footrace introduced
   at the Olympics. from the palace of Sargon II at Dur-Sharrukin.]] *722
   BCâSpring and Autumn Period of China's history begins as King Zhou ping wang
   of the Zhou Dynasty reigns in name only.
*  722 BCâNorthern Kingdom of Israel is conquered by Assyrian king Sargon II.
   *721 BCâThe Assyrians conquer the tribes of northern Israel.
*  721 BCâSargon II starts to rule. He builds a new capital at Dur Sharrukin
   (modern Khorsabad). *720 BCâEnd of the Assyrian siege of Tyre. *c. 720
   BCâGuardian figure (pictured, right), from the entrance to the throne
   room at palace of Sargon II is made. It is now kept in The Oriental
   Institute, Chicago.

Significant people *729 BCâTiglath-Pileser III officially crowned sovereign of
Asia in Babylon. *729 BCâHezekiah succeeds Ahaz as king of Judah (or 726 BC).
*729 BCâLuli succeeds Mattan II as king of Tyre. *728 BCâDeath of Tiglath-
Pileser III, king of Assyria (or 727 BC). *727 BCâDeath of Tiglath-Pileser III,
king of Assyria (or 728 BC). *727 BCâShalmaneser V becomes king of Assyria (dies
723 BC). *727 BCâTefnakhte founds the Twenty-fourth dynasty of Egypt. *726
BCâHezekiah succeeds Ahaz as king of Judah (or 729 BC). *725 BCâBakenranef (also
known as Bocchoris) succeeds his father Tefnakhte as king of the Twenty-fourth
dynasty of Egypt. *724 BCâAhaz, king of Judah (740 BCâ726 BC) dies. *723
BCâShalmaneser V, king of Assyria, dies. *723 BCâSargon succeeds Shalmaneser V
as king of Assyria. *721 BCâShabaka succeeds his father Piye as king of the Twenty-
fifth dynasty of Egypt. *720 BCâShabaka kills Bakenranef (Bocchoris), ending the
Twenty-fourth Dynasty of Egypt *720 BCâDeath of Zhou ping wang, King of the Zhou
Dynasty of China. *c. 720 BCâBirth of Guan Zhong, political adviser of Qi in
eastern Ancient China.
